meanings.definition: Money or a tip given as a reward or bribe.
meanings.sent1: He received bakshish for his hard work.
meanings.sent2: Leaving bakshish for the waiter is customary in some cultures.
meanings.sent3: The street performer happily collected bakshish from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The promise of bakshish often influences people's decisions.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's eyes lit up at the sight of the bakshish tossed into his cup.

meanings.definition: To give money or a tip as a reward or bribe.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bakshish the tour guide for his excellent service.
meanings.sent2: It is common to bakshish the staff at hotels for good service.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to bakshish each other with imaginary coins.
meanings.sent4: He tried to bakshish his way out of trouble, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent5: The businessman discreetly bakshished the official to speed up the process.
